text: Canette de 473 ml achetée chez LCBO (Casselman, ONT) au coût de 2,85$. Arôme: Odeur fruité. Apparence: La couleur est paille avec une très faible densité de bulle. Saveur: Léger goût de poire avec une pointe de miel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de poire en arrière goût. (Rating #7112)

Succession of sips stolen from Mrs Tikis glass. Can from LCBO at Royal Winter Fair (part of the local growers thing etc). Champagne style pour. Shimmers with bubbles. Crisp & clean perry. Pears dangle up front. Somewhere in the middlenof the dry vs sweet spectrum. Decent.
Pours a cloudy pale colour. Aroma has notes of pears, fruity esters, and some peppery yeast. Tasting notes include pear, apple, and some earthy yeasts. Not bad, very refreshing!

Thought the name was amusing so bought a can at the LCBO in Hamilton. Light cloudy gold with a lime green tint and a musty pear aroma. Light bodied and very dry. The taste is pear, tart a bit earthy and dry with a residual sweetness. Not bad though most ladies who tried it were looking for something sweeter.

[Can (473ml)] Pours a cloudy pale yellow-white with no head. Dry pear aroma, a touch tart and a bit sweet -- simple but decent. Pleasant enough dry pear flavour. Average bodied. A simple but enjoyable Perry.

pours hazy very light yellow, few tiny bubbles surfacing. citrusy pears, their tender and lightly tannic skin, never perfumey, granny smith sweetness and tartness balance; yeast - some complexity with young brett action, salt, other minerals, ginger. moderately low carbonation, light body, semi-sweet, chalky and gently tart citrusy finish. very nice perry.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear pale, slightly greenish straw colour with no head. Aroma is earthy pear and apple. Flavour is dank pear, a little apple and some nice earthiness. Light carbonation. Solid.
Bright pear skids..... Some. Light apples and sweet pear flesh. Low carb, fresh mouth feel, and quite refreshing. Not half bad.

473ml can. Pours no head whatsoever and has a pale yellowish appearance. No lacing. Aromas are a bit fruity, hints of pears, a bit dank. Flavours are very sweet, citric juices, sugary and syrupy. Pear flavour mainly in the finish. Has a tangy mouthfeel. It might be a bit much to have any more than the one tallboy. Too sweet.

[7659-20150918] Tap. Mineral apple juice aroma. Clear, pale white yellow body with a quick bubbly head. Sweet apple mineral flavour has a lingering aftertaste. Medium body. Good. (7/3/7-/3/13) 3.3
(TBW Fall Beer Fest 2015 @ Cest What, Toronto, ON)

2015-10-02. Crisp pale yellow body, headless. Aroma is modestly fruity, lightly earthy fruity pear and apple notes. Flavour is on the sweet side. Fruity apple and pear. Just a bit of rough earthy pear in the undertones. Smooth average bodied palate, low carbonation. Simplistic but tasty. On tap at Cest What, Toronto.
